Module 2CORE MODULETGS-2025052473

Strategies for Advising High-Net-Worth Individuals

Master HNWI Advisory & Relationship Building

Building and maintaining relationships with HNWIs and Family-owned Businesses is both an art and a science. This module equips learners with the tools, insights, and strategies necessary to attract, engage, and advise affluent clients effectively.

Module Focus:

HNWI and Family-owned business client acquisition strategies and frameworks, relevant products set and client suitability for propositions comprising multi-generational succession planning and business continuity, philanthropy and cross-border wealth issues.

1 Day
7.5 hours (including 0.5-hour MCQ Assessment)
7.5 Non-core Supplementary CPD Hours
In-Person Masterclass
MCQ Assessment
Prerequisites:

GCE 'A' Level (2 'A's and 2 'O's) or Diploma + 3 years relevant working experience

Technical Skills & Competencies (TSCs):
Client Investment SuitabilityLevel 4
Contact for Pricing & DetailsDownload BrochureView Full Program

üìú Part of Certification: This is a core module of the SCFP-HNWI certification program.

The Challenge

Advising HNWIs requires understanding their unique psychology, priorities, and complex financial needs. Generic advisory approaches fail to build the trust and rapport necessary for serving this sophisticated client segment.

The Solution

Master the breadth and depth of product sets in the industry and learn to create propositions that address complex needs. Build trust through meaningful interactions and handle complex conversations with confidence to position yourself as a trusted family advisor.

Key Outcomes

Understand the psychology and priorities of HNWIs and Family-owned businesses and their key concerns and decision-making factors

Craft personalized financial plans, exploring investment, estate planning, and risk management options for the targeted client segment

Build trust and rapport through meaningful interactions and handle complex conversations with confidence and professionalism to position yourself as a trusted family advisor

Learning Objectives

Design client acquisition strategies to specifically target potential HNWIs and Family-owned Businesses clients

Build trust and rapport through meaningful interactions and handle complex conversations with confidence

Master the breadth and depth of product sets in the industry and create propositions to address complex needs

Understand the risks of different product structures and structure effective solutions that meet client's product suitability

What You'll Learn

Understanding HNWI Psychology

  • ‚Ä¢Psychology and priorities of HNWIs and Family-owned businesses
  • ‚Ä¢Key concerns and decision-making factors of wealthy clients
  • ‚Ä¢Behavioral patterns of ultra-high-net-worth individuals
  • ‚Ä¢Family dynamics in wealth advisory relationships

Product Knowledge & Suitability

  • ‚Ä¢Breadth and depth of product sets for HNWI clients
  • ‚Ä¢Risk profiles of different product structures
  • ‚Ä¢Client investment suitability assessment
  • ‚Ä¢Product provider risk appetite thresholds

Complex Advisory Solutions

  • ‚Ä¢Multi-generational succession planning strategies
  • ‚Ä¢Business continuity planning for family businesses
  • ‚Ä¢Cross-border wealth management issues
  • ‚Ä¢Philanthropy planning and structures

Relationship Building

  • ‚Ä¢Building trust and rapport with wealthy clients
  • ‚Ä¢Handling complex conversations with confidence
  • ‚Ä¢Positioning as trusted family advisor
  • ‚Ä¢Meaningful client interactions and engagement

Upon Completion, You Will Be Able To

Understand psychology and priorities of HNWIs and Family-owned businesses

Design targeted client acquisition strategies for wealthy clients

Craft personalized financial plans for complex client needs

Master product sets and create suitable propositions

Handle complex advisory conversations with confidence

Position yourself as trusted family advisor for HNWI segment

Who Should Attend?

Financial advisors currently serving or aspiring to serve HNWI clients
Licensed representatives working with affluent families
Bancassurance specialists targeting wealthy segment
Advisors ready to elevate their practice to HNWI advisory
